page.title: 07Regional Government
page.content: Newtown St.Boswells is in a central position in the Borders Region, and when regionalisation took place in 1974 it was decided to use the office accomodation in the village for the Borders Regional Headquarters.Previously the offices had been the Headquarters of Roxburghshire County Council. The Borders Region are the only region in Scotland who have regional offices situated in a village rather than in a large town or city. Pressure of space is a major problem in the offices and they are constantly looking for extra areas to expand their office space.Part of the school garden was lost when temporary accomodation for the Architects' Department was constructed in the space.
